titleStmt.title: To GEORGE CHAPMAN,Probably George Chapman (1807-85), younger brother of Edward Chapman of Chapman & Hall; a land agent. See Pilgrim Letters 2, p. 89n. 25 JUNE 1840

body.p: Believe me that I am truly and sincerely obliged to you for your hearty Invitation, and that forest scenery, pretty country, old bachelors, birds beasts and trees, have all strong-holds in my affections. But I no more dare to leave town at present on such a jaunt, than I dare doCorrected from “to” by CD. any conceivable or inconceivable deed, the bare mention of which would make the hair of all human creatures stand on end with wonder.Reminiscent of the Ghost in Hamlet (I.v), who might make “each particular hair to stand on end” if he spoke of his abode. Every day since I have been here (except on Mondays when in common with other vagabonds Workmen who idle after Sunday’s dissipation: hence jokes about observing “Saint Monday”. For CD’s development of “vagabonding”, see e.g. To Felton, 31 July 42 (Pilgrim Letters 3, p. 293: “The United Vagabonds”) and To Cerjat, 4 Jan 69 (Pilgrim Letters 12, p. 268: “genteelly vagabondizing over the face of the earth”). I usually make holiday) I have been at my desk for many hours.CD was working on The Old Curiosity Shop (the “Giant Work”, with its “leaves”, below). I came here to escape the miscalled pleasures of town,CD had been in Broadstairs since 1 June and stayed for a month. which are pains and penaltiesA legal phrase that has passed into common usage, usually jocularly. to me, and have been obliged on sunny mornings to put a strong and resolute constraint upon myself, and to keep the shadow of my Giant WorkThe capitalisation humorously personifies the task in terms reminiscent of Bunyan’s Giant Despair. perpetually before me. I have many old and pressing invitations to Scotland, Ireland, Wales, the Lakes, and divers parts of divers English counties—some of them have for many reasons urgent claims upon me, but I can yield to none, and my country escapes must be limited for the present to quiet places near at hand, where I can [ ]Something illegible (about three letters) crossed out. take root and put out my leaves without interruption
